title: ‘Hippie’: A Long, Strange Trip From Savvy to Spaced-Out
text:
Great Britain’s Duke of Sussex, better known to the world as Prince Harry, had a message this week for readers of The Daily Telegraph. Writing from Malawi, where he was observing conservation efforts at national parks, Harry argued that it is necessary to “overcome greed, apathy and selfishness” if humanity is going to protect the planet from environmental destruction. He added, “This may well sound hippy to some. But we cannot afford to have a ‘them or us’ mentality.”

That comment led the BBC to wonder (also using Harry’s...
description: The label came from terms for “in the know” and “cool,” but—as Prince Harry suggested this week—now it suggests a certain naïveté.
